title: Global search
content:
To search for a record in Service Management, as a tenant administrator, you must first store and index this record in IDOL. By default, Service Management supports global search for a fixed set of record types (see Search behaviors). The Global search tab in Studio allows you to configure index fields so that you can enable global search for record types that you customized or other out-of-the-box (OOTB) record types that are currently unsearchable.

This section describes how to enable global search for custom or other OOTB record types through index field configuration.

Enable index field configuration for global search

  1. In the main menu of Service Management, go to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.
  2. Toggle on Enable index field configuration for global search.
    This allows you to add new index fields and enable global search for custom or more OOTB record types.
  3. Click Save.

Enable global search for a custom or an unsearchable OOTB record type

  1. Go to Studio, and then select either a custom record type or an OOTB record type.

    Currently, only the following OOTB record types support global search using index fields:

    • Purchase Order
    • Receiving Slip
    • Survey
  2. Click the Global search tab.
  3. Select Enable global search to start configuring index fields.

    Add index fields

    Add index fields for record types that are currently unsearchable

    After you select Enable global search for a custom record type or a currently unsearchable OOTB record type such as Purchase Order, you'll see the Id index field mandatory for each searchable record type has already been configured automatically.

    Global search does not support the RequestedFor or RequestedBy fields.

    You can start adding other desired fields by following these steps:

    1. In the Index field configuration section, click Add.
    2. In the New index field dialog box that appears, select a field from the drop-down list, choose an index weight, and if needed, configure it as the title, content, or both.

      Index weight is a key factor for calculating search relevance, which determines the display sequence of the search results. High indicates the highest weight, followed by Medium and Low. A higher weight means that such value will have a higher influence for showing results in search.

      An index field can be specified as the title, content, or both. After an index field is configured as the title of the indexed document, its weight will be automatically set to High, and the field value will show up in both the subject and summary of the search result. If an index field is configured as the content, its weight will be automatically set to Medium, and the field value will appear only in the summary part of the search result.

      You can only add fields of the following logical type as index fields:

      • SMALL_TEXT
      • MEDIUM_TEXT
      • LARGE_TEXT
      • RICH_TEXT
    3. Click OK.
    4. If needed, add multiple index fields for the record type. Make sure at least one index field is configured as the title and one field is configured as the content. Or, configure one of the fields as both the title and content.

      Adding too many index fields will result in a mass amount of resource consumption and lower search performance. We recommend that you only index the necessary data. If the search becomes slow, the suite administrator can check if content group scaling is needed. See Administer Smart Analytics.
    5. Click Save.

    Add index fields for record types already searchable

    By default, Service Management supports global search for a list of record types such as requests and incidents. However, only a selected number of fields, as shown in the following figure, can be used for keyword-based searches. Currently, these fields aren't configurable.


     

    Besides the existing read-only index fields, if you want to search records based on some custom fields or additional fields, you can add them as new index fields. For example, if you add the custom field tags to Request and you want to search requests that are tagged as “network issue”, you can add this tags field as an index field. The process of adding new index fields is the same as that of adding index fields for record types that are currently unsearchable, as mentioned in the preceding section.

    Dev2Prod

    You can export the index field configurations as part of the configurations of a record type and import the data to another tenant. For more information about the process, see Dev2Prod.

    Perform a full reindex

    After you configure the index fields, only the records created or updated after you made this change will be indexed in IDOL with the new configuration. If you want to apply the new configuration to a set of existing records, follow these steps to perform a full reindex:

    1. Determine the data scope for which you want to apply the new index settings.
      • To reindex data created or updated after a specific time, select the Reindex data created/updated after checkbox and specify a date.
      • To reindex all data, skip configuring the date.
    2. Click Start full reindex.
      Some messages will appear on the UI, indicating that the full reindex task has been triggered.
      Full reindex tasks run asynchronously. If you select another record type when the reindex task is still in progress, you'll find that in the Full reindex section, only the Stop full reindex button is enabled. You can stop it if needed.
      It will take at least half an hour for the reindex to complete. When the task finishes, a message will appear at the bottom of the page, telling you how many records have been reindexed and how many records failed.

    Use global search

    After the index field configuration, follow these steps to check if the records are searchable on the Agent interface (Service Management) as expected:

    1. Refresh the page.
    2. Search a keyword that you have configured as an index field.
    3. Select the record type for which you have enabled global search, and then click the search icon.
      You'll find the records with the search keyword highlighted in the search result.
    On Service Portal side, you can find the newly added index fields reflected in the search results.
